Mini 1107: Just a Game


This is a Mafia Game. Unlike other places where whole towns are at risk of being taken over by a group of maniacs, you are just some people trying to get the day over with a good game.
As always, there are some of you, who take the game more seriously and others who join only for fun. All of you, however, share an interest in winning ranging from moderate to obsessive.
The best of you (or maybe the luckiest) shall win.

LET THE GAME BEGIN (and don't forget the rules)!


1. General Rules
1.1 This is a game. Have fun.
1.2 Rule violations will be dealt case by case. I am not afraid to modkill, should it be necessary.
1.3 If you think I made a mistake contact me.
1.4 Usually I will post in bolded orange.
1.5 My decision is final on whatever is going on in this game.
1.6 What your role PM says has priority over every one of the following rules.

2. Votes and Lynches
2.1 To vote a person use vote tags, e.g. VOTE: Tasky or bold your vote. If your vote is already on someone, an unvote would be nice.
2.2 You may use abbreviations as long as it's clear who you want to vote.
2.3 If I think you meant to vote, I will count the vote.
2.4 As soon as the majority of the players vote at the same time for a player, that player is immediately lynched.
2.5 You may VOTE: No Lynch, as you would vote any player. If half of the players (rounded up) vote No Lynch, the day will end without lynch.
2.6 After a lynch, no one is considered dead until I lock the tread. Therefore every player is allowed to post during twilight.

3. Do and Don't
3.1 The only place you are allowed to talk about this game is in this thread or in a PM addressed at me and only at me.
3.2 You may not edit or delete any posts of this thread.
3.3 Do not quote or pretend to quote any private communication with me. This includes your role PM.
3.4 Play to win. Don't do anything obviously detrimental to your faction on purpose.

4. Prods and Replacements
4.1 You are allowed to be on V/LA for no more than half day's maximal lenght and only if you are back at least two days before deadline. If you plan on being away for longer, I will replace you.
4.2 If you do not post in thread for more than 60 hours without announcing a V/LA, you will be prodded.
4.3 If a player fails to pick up his prod and post in thread for more than 36 hours, he will be forced to replaced out or modkilled.
4.4 Every player may request a prod or a forced replacement. I will then consider his/her request.
4.5 The sooner I know you have to be replaced, the better it is for me and for the game. If you know you will have to replace out, let me know in advance

5. Deadlines
5.1 First day's deadline d1 will be 21 days after the game starts.
5.2 After that, the deadline in days of the k-th day is dk=3+nk+(dk-1-lk_1)/2 where nk is the number of players alive and lk-1 is the length of day k-1.
5.3 Deadline extensions may be granted in extraordinary situations.
5.4 I may reduce day deadline's by up to 50% if I feel activity is low.
5.5 Night deadline is always 48 hours.
5.6 Night actions I haven't got until deadline, will either not happen or be randomized (whichever I think is more damaging to your faction). If you wish not to perform any action, I want that stated explicitly.

6. Setup
6.1 This is a setup for 12 players.
6.2 There may be one regular Serial Killer.
6.3 There is exactly one mafia faction.
6.4 There may be any number of following roles: Mafia Goon, Mafia Godfather, Mafia Framer, Mafia Ninja, Mafia Traitor, Mafia/Town Roleblocker, Mafia/Town (role/alignment-)Cop, Mafia/Town Doctor, Mafia/Town Tracker, Mafia/Town Watcher, Town Jailkeeper, Town Vigilante, Town Masons.
6.5 There may be one other role in the game which will either be Town or Mafia aligned. You might never have seen this role before.
6.6 There are at least three Vanilla Townies.

7. Flavor
7.1 I might write some flavor for this game if I feel like it. All flavor is entirely original.
7.2 Every part of flavor is only for my and your enjoyment and has no bearing on the game. This includes kill flavors.


Spoiler: Sample Role PM's
Vanilla Townie wrote:You are a Vanilla Townie.

Special Abilities:
You have no special abilities.

Win Condition:
You win iff no living player's win condition requires you to die (or nothing can prevent the same).

Mafia Goon wrote:You are a Mafia Goon. You are in a team with ???? and ????.

Special Abilities:
You have no special abilities.

Mafia-abilities: (active, night) Target a living player. If this ability resolves successfully, your target will die. You may not use this ability if any other Mafia member uses it the same night.

Safehouse:
During the night you may discuss freely with your scumbuddies in this quicktopic: ????

Win Condition:
You win iff only Mafia aligned players are alive (or nothing can prevent the same).

Yesterday we had a lot of aggressive/reckless bandwagoning and a very early lynch ... and I'd say it didn't do us much good. Not only did we mislynch, but I don't think we learned a whole lot. And yet things are already shaping up the same way today.

I looked again at each player and took some notes; and thought I might as well post them to try and prompt some discussion on some different topics. These are roughly in order of how townlike each person appears to me.

Vigilante Ventriloquist
Seems to me his Day 1 posts were the best and most pro-town by a considerable distance.

Neruz
The subject of a lot of early pressure. I didn't see anything suspicious in his play, and I thought he defended himself pretty convincingly.

Cecily
Hasn't said much, but came under a bit of pressure and responded plausibly. Has made some good points against Riceballtail.

sordros
Again - hasn't said much, but I've agreed with most of it. I'd like to see a lot more before I mark him down as town, though.

Hiraki
He's one of the most aggressive attackers of Neruz. The reasons still seem poor to me ... but since Parama and ICEninja made very similar cases as townies, it's hard to say that the attacks are suspicious. Of the still-living players, he's the one who has disagreed most with VV. Again his reasoning on those points seems poor/wrong to me, but it's not obvious that the motivation is suspicious. I didn't like his "unvote" after Parama reached the lynch point. That looks doubly bad given that he wasn't even voting for Parama. Also somewhat suspicious is his often aggressive tone, occasionally stepping over the line into insults. I think both are anti-town, because they distract town players from effective mafia-hunting. But some people just behave that way online, so it's not a very clear indicator of guilt. Summary: at the moment I read Hiraki as someone who has a very high opinion of his own abilities. I haven't seen anything yet to justify that opinion, but he's not at the top of my list of suspects.

mockingjaye
Only 1 real post so far, but made some decent points. I regard lurking as suspicious, and mockingjaye will be on my suspect list until she contributes more.

Nobody Special
Extremely difficult to read, which I don't like. I think tend to think townpeople should make it easy for other townfolk to recognise them. That also makes it harder for the mafia to fit in. Parama isn't playing that way if he's town. He resists the Neruz lynch, but without explaining why. He pursues a lynch on Parama, then switches to ICEninja - again without giving any reasons. Then NS settles on Parama when he contradicts himself, and says "My vote will not move from here." This is much too inflexible, and doesn't give Parama any chance to explain his actions. I don't like the lack of transparency in NS's play, nor his lack of openness to arguments.

werewolf555
Has said very little, and I don't understand the "I am cool" breadcrumb thing at all.

Riceballtail
8 posts but hardly any content. In particular, two votes for Neruz with no explanation whatsoever. My top suspect right now.
@Riceballtail: please explain your current vote.


Overall
There are several players who haven't contributed much to the game so far. To some extent this is explainable by a lot of loud and aggressive play from other people on Day 1. But now that two of the main perpetrators have gone, I hope we'll see a better spread of activity. I'm not going to vote right now because I hope the game will slow down a little and allow time for more discussion - and a wider range of topics.

----------

I'd like to encourage other players to post a similar summary of their reads, at some point Today. I think it helps to stimulate discussion on new topics, which is good for the town. It also forces mafia to state their positions on people, and more difficult for them to switch later when the situation demands it. Finally, it helps townfolk to identify each another - which is a crucial part of mafia-hunting.

It's a statistics thing you'll probably run into every now and then. The town have a slight statistical advantage on a lynch if there are an odd number of people alive.
To see why, it's pretty easy; lets say you have 2 games, 1 with 7p, 1 with 8p, both with two scum. A random lynch in the 7p game has a 2/7 chance of hitting scum, but a random lynch in the 8p game has a 2/8 (1/4) chance, which is slightly less.

It's not hugely significant, if a town player has some form of role related information pointing to scum and are worried that they might be night killed then they should come forward with that now and we'll decide if a no lynch is still the best option.
